str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To dwell in, among. From en and katoikeo; to settle down in a place, i.e. Reside.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To examine, as by torture; I torment; I buffet, as of waves. From basanos; to torture.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
Lawless, wicked, without law. (by implication, a Gentile), or (positively) wicked.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
A look, glance; sight and hearing. From blepo; vision.
Hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor. From akouo; hearing.
